title: Ticket #3139: job description attribute in the job ClassAd
description:
Add a new attribute in the job Class Ad: the job description.
It is simply a field where a brief description of the job can be specified by the user in the submit file when they add the line: 

     description = the given description

When a job has that field set, condor_q must display the description instead of the executable name, as follows: 

     [santos-g@condor-student1] (290)$ ./condor_q


     -- Submitter: condor-student1.cs.wisc.edu : <128.105.175.42:51937> : condor-student1.cs.wisc.edu
      ID      OWNER            SUBMITTED     RUN_TIME ST PRI SIZE DESCRIPTION
     8319.0   santos-g        7/18 16:08   0+00:00:00 I  0   97.7 (the given description).

Also, Interactive jobs will generate a description automatically if one is not specified.
remarks:
2012-Jul-18 16:17:17 by johnkn:
The default descripion for Interative jobs should include the fully qualified domain name of the submitting machine. something like 

       (Interactive from condor-student3.cs.wisc.edu)

-tj

2012-Jul-20 17:54:04 by santos-g:
When a given job has a description, it will print it instead of the command in the CMD column.

The given example shows the output (without the -wide option): 

   ID      OWNER            SUBMITTED     RUN_TIME ST PRI SIZE CMD
  8932.0   santos-g        7/20 16:26   0+00:00:00 I  0   97.7 python python_job.
  8933.0   santos-g        7/20 16:28   0+00:00:00 I  0   97.7 (Interactive from )
  8936.0   santos-g        7/20 17:29   0+00:00:00 I  0   97.7 (hey this is a rea)

Job (#8932.0) has no description. Job (#8933.0) is interactive with no description, so a default description is given to it and shown there. Job (#8936.0) was given a description.

And below is the output with -wide: 

   ID      OWNER            SUBMITTED     RUN_TIME ST PRI SIZE CMD
  8932.0   santos-g        7/20 16:26   0+00:00:00 I  0   97.7 python python_job.py 0
  8933.0   santos-g        7/20 16:28   0+00:00:00 I  0   97.7 (Interactive from condor-student1.cs.wisc.edu)
  8936.0   santos-g        7/20 17:29   0+00:00:00 I  0   97.7 (hey this is a really looong description!)

2012-Oct-03 11:16:24 by tannenba:
The description for interactive jobs need not contain the submitting machine; this is redundant and potentially incorrect info. Condor already shows the submitting machine for any job, interactive or not.

2012-Oct-03 11:35:02 by tannenba:
Is the description attribute honored in condor_history as well as condor_q? It should be.

Also, why do the identical commits show up twice in the related commits below? Wonky merging problems or?

2012-Oct-03 13:00:02 by santos-g:
Changed the default description for an interactive job. Now it is simply "Interactive job".

No, condor_history does not show anything related to the JobDescription attribute in the Job ClassAd.

Not even if -l is used to display the entire ClassAd: 

 ./condor_history -l |grep JobDescription

Note that 

 ./condor_history -l |grep Cmd
will display the Cmd value correctly.

I'll have to work on that too. Now, I noticed a bug in that tool:

If one issues a command and gives it a invalid parameter, it will print 

  ID      OWNER            SUBMITTED     RUN_TIME ST   COMPLETED CMD
and hang indefinitely. I ran into this behavior because I expected condor_history to have/accept a -wide parameter just like condor_q does.

So when I tackle this, I'll add a -wide parameter to it as well.

2012-Oct-03 13:49:58 by tstclair:
I see no conflict between JobDescription and Submission, and they could possibly be used in conjunction with one another.

imho I don't think it should overwrite the existing column, but possibly append a new one.
